title: @Riot, Could you make CS a liiiiittle bit less important for grades in RGM modes and ARAM?
body:
http://imgur.com/OoBbDHl

12/0/13, not bad. But wait, I'm the worst player of my entire team because I only had 19 CS. Forget that I had more gold than Nocturne and midlane Orianna dispite this low CS and forget about my highest kill participation (2nd highest dmg to champs) and lowest death count. I sucked at CSing.

And you know why? Because I was in lane with Vel'Koz who cleared waves instantly so that I could easily land my Qs. Our lane synergy was on point and we killed the first turret and inhib BEFORE 2v1 toplane.

Yes, it was a 5v4 and I personally think that it's too easy right now to get S scores in 5v4s (system should take this into account and compare it with other 5v4 games) but I cringe by the fact of how important Riot rates CS **in gamemodes where you're laning with more than 1 person**. Hexakill, OFA, URF, ARAM and Nemisis draft should not have the same weight in their grade for early CS.

The game after, I had 14/9/19 on Vladimir. Meh, not as good as the previous game, but still okay. I received S+. Why? Because with 165 CS I had the highest of my team. Good for me. (I actually get S or S+ half the time in this mode, even with shitty KDA, because I usually splitpush.)
________
##Make (early game) CS less important for grades when you play in lanes with 2 or more people. The one with waveclear/who is allowed all the farm by their teammates shouldn't get an automatic S+. They'll already have an advantage by having more gold than the rest. Sometimes your role in the team isn't to farm early. But in these game modes, Riot's system doesn't seem to recognize it when players are willingly not going for the CS but giving it to their team instead.

replies.body: CSing is a skill, and if you aren't good enough at that skill then you don't deserve the high skill grade of an S/S+, it's the main thing that gets you money and early leads. Supports can still get high grades without that much cs, as long as they're playing an actual support champ. Any midlaner/top/jungler or adc should get high cs though.

Completely agree. In Summoner's Rift normals/ranked. When you're the only one farming in your lane and every CS that you didn't get is one that you failed to get.

When you're playing with 2, 3 or 5 in one lane, it's often a choice to give one player most of the CS (the one with waveclear, or a hyper-carry) while others focus on poking.

They need to consider CS for the grade but not REQUIRE that it reaches a certain threshold to achieve high ranks. EX: 5/0/5 and 170 CS should be comparable to 10/0/10 and 100 CS. Lack of CS could just mean that you're coordinating fantastically, getting barons and having teammates clear waves while you apply enormous pressure. 

When I play super aggressive champions this always happens. Nevermind the fact that I have 80% kill participation, more than half the team's kills, a perfect KDA, and applied so much pressure that the enemy team surrendered at 20:02. I don't have a shit ton of CS so I guess I'm trash according to the champion mastery system.

That and towers. 

Just played a game of Jayce and I took every tower but 1 (including nexus towers). One of those I took I took about 80% of it even then, and 100% of the others (team was chasing and fighting while I just pushed cause no one stopped me).

The point is that in some gamemodes, you can easily abuse the system by non-stop farming and S games are handed out to the wrong people. Sometimes I go splitpush because I'm 0/3 and end up 4/7/7 and I still get S because I got the highest CS.

Tbh this grading system is just impossible. It's waaaay too random and all over the place. My friend with overall worse score than me (like everything was below me).. he got an A and i got an A -. Sorry, but's that bshit.

Don't forget, you have to play far better than average to get the ess grade, and it depends on your champion. Obviously, Nidalees from other U.R.F. games did a better job at Nidalee than you. And only a small percentage of players of your allies' champions have done better than them.

I know how the grading works. I've played a ton of games in normals, ARAM and RGMs and I can tell you that in any role where you aren't the farmer, the system is highly screwed based on CS which isn't even your main goal.

The point is that it's near impossible to get S grades when your farm is really low. Even when you've contributed the most towards kills and turret kills. I've had many S games in this mode with other OP champs, but that's because I usually farm A LOT. Just this time I was in a lane with a waveclear champion and we didn't even get out of laning phase.

If you think that it's so easy to get this score with nidalee, then go ahead. I haven't even seen anyone winning a game with 0 deaths in the 21 games I've played so far (of which I had S- or higher in 8 games.)
